i am on the samba site now all i found s: hello. i tried installing Ubuntu into my laptop which has winxp pro, but i've run into problems. i followed the instructions in: https://wiki.ubuntu.com/WindowsDualBootHowTo
everything installed fine, then when it rebooted to complete ubuntu installation i just had a blank screen that read: missing operating system
i thought it had to do with the partitioning
i was still able to undo everything, so it's not a disaster problem
but i'm trying to figure out how to do it right... i really want to install linux
so you know what went wrong?
sounds like you messed up your partitioning

i'd reinstall, deleting the ext2 and swap paritions, then auto partition the free space.  leave everything it sets as default from there (i.e. which to make bootable)  and say yes when it asks to install grub to the MBR.
you said you now have: [1] NTFS winxp [2]  linux ext2 [3]  swap [4]  fat32
that will create some free space
then highlight the free space and select auto-partition
then leave every other setting as default
leave some free space, then just use that to install ubuntu to when you run the ubuntu install
